definition: enemy-held territory
to sink (into ruin, oblivion)/to be reduced to
pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect
surname Ou
area/region/district/small/distinguish/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In the occupied areas everything is in the hands of Japanese imperialism.
sentences.chinese: 在沦陷区，则一切被日本帝国主义所独占。

sentences.english: In the first section, I compare the colonial literatures of the two areas.
sentences.chinese: 本论文第一部分是对两地沦陷区的文学的比较。

sentences.english: It is the accomplice of Japanese invaders to carry out ideological enslavement activities in enemy-occupied area.
sentences.chinese: 它是日本侵略者在沦陷区实行思想奴化活动的帮凶。

sentences.english: The essential of contradiction conflict is the dominion power of occupied region.
sentences.chinese: 这种矛盾冲突的实质是争夺沦陷区的统治权。

sentences.english: During the invasion period of Japan to China, Japan implemented the thorough enslavement education in the enemy-occupied area.
sentences.chinese: 日本侵华期间，在沦陷区实施了彻底的奴化教育。

sentences.english: As a woman writer in the colonized Northeast China, Mei Niang owns her own unique literary style .
sentences.chinese: 作为东北沦陷区女作家，梅娘的创作独具风格。

sentences.english: Xin Qiji advocates " Attack enemy " , and his idea have the intense emotion that it was bring from the enemy-occupied area people's.
sentences.chinese: 辛弃疾则主张“攻人”，带着沦陷区人民强烈的情感。

sentences.english: Besides, this chapter also reviews study in literature referring Japan-occupied area.
sentences.chinese: 另外，本章还对沦陷区文学研究概况予以回顾。
